conversations.user_input: User: I have just been accepted into the Maths  major at HKUST. Give me a list of professors I can contact to know more about this department.
conversations.response:
Congratulations on your acceptance into the Maths major at HKUST!

I'd be happy to help you with that. Based on the information I have, here's a list of professors you can contact to know more about the Department of Mathematics:

1. Mo MU (Professor) - mamu@ust.hk
2. Yuan YAO (Professor) - yuany@ust.hk
3. Yongchang ZHU (Professor) - mazhu@ust.hk
4. Zhigang BAO (Associate Professor) - mazgbao@ust.hk
5. Ivan Chi Ho IP (Associate Professor) - ivanip@ust.hk
6. Shuoqing DENG (Assistant Professor) - masdeng@ust.hk
7. Xinzhou GUO (Assistant Professor) - xinzhoug@ust.hk
8. Quoc HO (Assistant Professor) - maqho@ust.hk
9. Qingyuan JIANG (Assistant Professor) - jiangqy@ust.hk
10. Maximilian Alexander NITZSCHNER (Assistant Professor) - mnitzschner@ust.hk

You can reach out to them via email or visit their personal websites (listed in their profiles) to learn more about their research interests and areas of expertise. They might be able to provide valuable insights into the department and help you navigate your academic journey.

Remember to introduce yourself, mention your interest in the Maths major, and ask specific questions about the department or their research areas. Good luck, and I hope you have a great time at HKUST!

(Source: https://facultyprofiles.hkust.edu.hk/profiles.php)

conversations.user_input: User: What do you know about the Math department at HKUST ?
conversations.response:
The Math department at HKUST! From what I've gathered, the department has a diverse range of faculty members with impressive educational backgrounds from top-notch universities like the University of British Columbia, University of California, Los Angeles, and Fudan University, to name a few.

I've come across several faculty profiles, including Chi Wai YU, Yin Bon KU, Tsz Kin LAM, Jing YAO, and Guibo YE, among others. They hold various positions, such as Assistant Professor, Lecturer, and more, and have expertise in different areas of mathematics, including statistics, systems analysis, and applied mathematics.

If you're interested in learning more, I can suggest checking out their personal websites or faculty profiles on the HKUST website, which provide more information about their research interests and contact details.

Source: https://facultyprofiles.hkust.edu.hk/profiles.php (and other faculty profiles linked within the provided context)

conversations.user_input: User: What do you know about the Mathematics department at HKUST ?
conversations.response:
The Mathematics department at HKUST! From what I've gathered, the department has a diverse range of faculty members with impressive educational backgrounds from renowned institutions worldwide. I've come across several professors with PhDs from universities like the University of British Columbia, University of California, Los Angeles, The State University of New York at Stony Brook, Fudan University, and more.

These faculty members hold various positions, including Assistant Professor, Lecturer I, and more. They have expertise in different areas of mathematics, such as statistics, applied mathematics, systems analysis, and integration.

If you're interested in getting in touch with them, I've found their contact details, including phone numbers, email addresses, and room numbers. Some of them even have personal websites and faculty profiles on the HKUST website.

That's a brief overview of what I know about the Mathematics department at HKUST. Would you like to know more about a specific faculty member or their research interests?

(Source: https://facultyprofiles.hkust.edu.hk/profiles.php)

conversations.response:
Congratulations on your admission to the math major program at HKUST!

You'll have the opportunity to interact with a talented pool of faculty members from the Department of Mathematics. Based on the information I have, you'll likely encounter faculty members like Shuoqing DENG, Xinzhou GUO, Quoc HO, Qingyuan JIANG, Maximilian Alexander NITZSCHNER, Mo MU, Yuan YAO, Yongchang ZHU, Zhigang BAO, and Ivan Chi Ho IP, among others.

These faculty members have diverse research interests and expertise, ranging from applied mathematics to statistics, algebra, and more. You can expect to learn from their experiences and gain valuable insights from them throughout your academic journey.

Source: https://facultyprofiles.hkust.edu.hk/profiles.php (Faculty profiles of the Department of Mathematics, HKUST)

conversations.user_input: User: What happens if I fail a course? Can I retake it?
conversations.response:
Don't worry, failing a course isn't the end of the world! According to the academic regulations, if you receive an F grade, you can repeat the course, but there are some conditions. Normally, you can repeat a failed course only once without needing any special approval. However, if you want to repeat it again, you'll need to get permission from the relevant Dean or their designee.

Also, keep in mind that the rules for calculating your grade averages differ depending on when you were admitted to the university. If you were admitted in 2023-24 or later, the previous F grade will be excluded from your grade averages, and only the latest attempt will be counted. But if you were admitted in 2022-23 or earlier, both the previous F grade and the repeated attempt will be included in your grade averages.

So, to answer your question, yes, you can retake a course, but make sure you understand the rules and regulations surrounding it!

(Source: data/Academic regulations.txt)
